data.title: Show a list of used command history
data.body:
When you press `Ctrl + 3` it shows you all available commands.
Is it possible to get a **list of the latest used commands**?

Thank you!

data.title: Wasted Space in VS Code Markdown Preview Pane is … A Pain
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.11.1 (1.11.1)
- OS Version: Mac OS X 10.11.6


I'm writing a README.md file in VS Code, and I'm seeing over half the preview pane being left blank. I don't recall this happening when I used VS Code for the same purpose last summer -- I was getting nice full preview panes.

![wasted-preview-space](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16212073/24839393/5db0457a-1d0e-11e7-9b3a-83cd0adeb4b2.png)
Bug? Misconfiguration on my part?

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Rename Markdown file (attached) to simple .nd extensiion
[README.md.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/908389/README.md.txt)
2. Open file in VS Code
3. Enter preview mode

data.title: @summary jsdoc support
data.body:
========= Feature Request ============

It would be nice if @summary and @description paramaters were recognized in jsdocs to provide better intellisense.  I'd consider the description of what the function does to be more important than its types. Visual Studio already has this feature.

data.title: Fix #24240
data.body: Adds `...` to long extension names.

data.title: Git: abitlity to filter files in git CHANGES list
data.body: It is really nice that now one can select multiple files in CHANGES view of GIT. But it would be really great if one could also filter those files using some search input, for example, I would type `/folder/` I in changes view there only files that are in `~/folder`.

data.title: Compound launch selector breaks when paused
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: win

![](https://drive.google.com/uc?id=0B-OJBofmehO3OERnZmd1V3p3Y00)
(it is "expanded" on this pic)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. have a server/client launch (tried both with compound launch and by running each part manually) where server is a node launch and client is either Firefox or Chrome debuggers
2. set a breakpoint in a client js file.
3. run

Or use [this case](/Spown/vsc_ff_debug_test_webapp/tree/compoun_bselector_bug):
1. set a breakpoint [here](/Spown/vsc_ff_debug_test_webapp/blob/compoun_bselector_bug/static/js/index.js#L8)
2. run ``Launch platform.js`` first and either ``Launch index (FF)`` or ``Launch index (Ch)`` (will probably require a page reaload to hit the breakpoint)
3. When the client is paused the bug should reveal itself
4. after stepping over the selector repairs itself, but after hitting resume - it breaks again. Hitting stop (when the selector is broken) also should repair it and will show the only one item.

Thanx

data.title: [PROPOSAL] Disable extensions by workspace
data.body:
Hi... I'm using VSCode and many extensions because i have many different projects...

These projects can be of different languages, like, JS, Swift, Python and can be use Docker o Vagrant...

If i'm working in an Python project, i don't need Swift or JS extensions like `eslint` for example.

Should be nice and useful load only the required extensions for every project, this config can be saved in the workspace (`.vscode` folder)

data.title: vscode crash after every changes in project files
data.body: I recently update vscode to the latest version in MacOS sierra 10.12.4. I don't use version control in my project but after every change in files It crashes and show 99+ on the version control icon! then it show this error or sometimes wants to reload or close the window

data.title: bug for python in vscode
data.body:
hello

I found a bug about vscode, that I can't see the input prompt when I run the following python code.

test.py:
#encoding:utf-8
birth = raw_input('birth: ')
if birth < 2000:
    print u'00前'
else:
    print u'00后'

data.title: Paths in tsconfig in Angular CLI
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Checkout the following repo https://github.com/antonkarsten/sample
2. Have a look at the tsconfig file is src/tsconfig.app.json (so it is not the tsconfig.json in the root). This is particular to angular-cli (https://cli.angular.io/)
If you look on line 8 in src/app/app.module.ts you can see how I imported the button component. VSCode shows this as an error. 
3. But the project works because of the paths property in the tsconfig.app.json. When you run the project (with the command ng serve) everything is fine.

Maybe Im doing something wrong. Thats possible as well
Anton

data.title: Impossible to start up correctly on macOS since 1.11
data.body:
Since the update, I have not been able to start vs code up on macOS, on either stable or insider builds. I had no insider build installed at all until I downloaded it to see if it would work, but it has the same symptoms.

Opening the editor from the dock, finder, or via `open` from a terminal with clean environment (`/bin/sh`) results in this:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/73085/24836277/cbe213cc-1d52-11e7-9bf0-819ae8ff8dc5.png)

Almost nothing functions at all; the window can be resized, but not dragged; it can be closed, but not with keyboard shortcuts. The menu options seem to mostly work, or at least the ones that don't do things directly to the window contents. The inspector from the Toggle Developer Tools in the Help menu also works, though not any of the keyboard shortcuts. Can't use Cmd+A to select text, for example.

However, the interesting part is that opening it with the `code` command line does work, at least some of the time. Sometimes, it will work, but the keyboard will be completely non-functional, and the shortcuts that do work are incorrect for my keyboard layout (but valid qwerty). Opening it from my fully functional shell (with all profile scripts) by invoking the `Contents/MacOS/Electron` binary also works; it doesn't on the bare shell mentioned earlier.

During the update from 1.10 to 1.11, I clicked on the editor icon only about 3 seconds or so after it closed, so I wonder if that could cause some kind of corruption. However, removing and re-downloading the editor, or even deleting everything under `~/Library/Application Support/Code` does not help.

data.title: Allow any tab to be moved across instances
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: CentOS Linux release 7.3.1611

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open 2 VSCode windows
2. In the first vscode window go to Help -> Welcome
3. Try to move (drag and drop) the "Welcome" tab to the second window
4. Nothing happens, unlike editable documents which can be moved using the same usage pattern, this affects any kind of preview tab

Closes https://github.com/joaompinto/asciidoctor-vscode/issues/14 , opening as a vscode issue, reproducing  without 3rd party extensions involved.

data.title: Can't have '#' in the path to project directory
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Win7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create a folder with '#' in the name as first symbol
2. open a new folder in vscode somewhere inside that folder
3. watch it helplessly try creating any of those "/.vscode/*.json" settings files and failing without throwing any error or warning

Everything else works as far as I could tell, but not config files.

data.title: HTML: Span Tag breaks formatting.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1 - OS Version: Windows 10 Pro Latest ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/452199/24836055/a4395f48-1d1a-11e7-8a79-4418bf325ab3.png) Steps to Reproduce: 1. settings.json config: ``` "editor.formatOnSave": true, "html.format.enable": true, "html.format.indentHandlebars": true, "html.format.maxPreserveNewLines": 0, "html.format.wrapLineLength": 120, ``` 2. Put this into an htm file: ```
``` 3. Format document 4. Expected formatting ```
``` This also happens without the ```

data.title: zoomed release notes are cropped
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.1 (d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39, 2017-04-06T13:58:12.954Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.0|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.3|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open release notes (Help -> Release Notes)
2. zoom by pressing ctrl +
3. as the text size is increased with each zoom (as expected), the window is cropped both horizontally and vertically

data.title: package.json / scoped packages no autocomplete
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Win 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a `package.json file`
2. Go to section `dependencies` / `devDependencies` / `peerDependencies` / `optionalDependencies`
3. As the package name key, start typing any scoped package that starts with `@` like `@types/minimatch`
4. There is no autocomplete.

It seems like this url, that is being used [here](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/cc8df7305bebe1559ac0a2af270bdf2daf518185/extensions/javascript/src/features/packageJSONContribution.ts#L54) does return 0 result when search term starts with an `@`:

https://skimdb.npmjs.com/registry/_design/app/_view/browseAll?group_level=1&limit=50&start_key=["@"]&end_key=["@z",{}].

I'm using the same query in autocomplete-json for atom, and have been having the same issue https://github.com/bali182/autocomplete-json/issues/65 . Now npm doesn't seem to have too much docs on how to query their rest api, do you guys have any idea how to fix this?

2.But I search my vscode's  extension,doesn't find it

data.title: Debug pauses, callstack not available
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
    Version 1.12.0-insider
    Commit 77df7646504961abefe7c735d7a10171abce9d4a
    Date 2017-04-07T06:09:22.690Z

- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

- Debug protocol: "Auto (inspect, Node 7.7.1)"

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19211868/24835249/03b17124-1d05-11e7-8122-01adf292f39b.png)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Put a breakpoint somewhere,
2. Debug, get to the breakpoint
3. Press F5 - debug will freeze and callstack will show "Callstack not available"

data.title: Command+Q does not work
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.1 (d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39, 2017-04-06T14:00:34.044Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0
- Extensions: the listing exceeds the lower minimum of browsers' URL characters limit
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Visual studio code
2. Press Command + Q
3. Visual studio code does not close

data.title: All default hotkeys are missing after update

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
after update vscode doesn't know about ctrl+c, ctrl+v, ctrl+z, ctrl+y, ctrl+q etc. even when I have no extensions installed, even if I install vscode to fresh system.
